class wisps.data_mgmt.Location.Location¶

Bases: wisps.data_mgmt.nc_writable.nc_writable

Class to hold location data. Includes latitude and longitude array, as well as the station names

num_stations()¶

Returns the number of stations.

write_to_nc(nc_handle)¶

Writes this objects netCDF representation as a netCDF Variable to the nc_handle.

Class reproesenting the Bounded time. The bounded time represents an instant in time separated duration

adds a bounds array to the object, where stride is the number of time steps to skip, and offset is the starting point in the array

Return a tuple of dimension names. Will account for data with different shapes.

class wisps.data_mgmt.Time.ForecastReferenceTime(**kwargs)¶

Bases: wisps.data_mgmt.Time.Time

Class representing the Forecast reference time. Where the Forecast Reference time is the ‘data time’, the time of the analysis from which the forecast was made.

append_reference_time(ref_time)¶
class wisps.data_mgmt.Time.LeadTime(**kwargs)¶

Bases: wisps.data_mgmt.Time.Time

Class representing the lead time. The lead_time Length of time (a duration) from forecast_reference_time to the Phenomenon time

add_common_metadata(nc_var)¶

Adds metadata that is common to LeadTime variables.

get_dimensions()¶

Return a tuple of dimension names. Will account for data with different shapes.

get_index(num_seconds)¶

Returns index where the lead time data equals num_seconds. Throws error if multiple indicies are found or none are found.

class wisps.data_mgmt.Time.PhenomenonTime(**kwargs)¶

Bases: wisps.data_mgmt.Time.Time

Class representing the Phenomenon Time Instant Phenomenon time is colloquially, when the weather happens. It can be either an instant in time or A period of time.

get_dimensions()¶

Return a tuple of dimension names. Will account for data with different shapes.

get_index(num_seconds)¶

Returns index where the lead time data equals num_seconds. Only checks if the start bound is equal to the input argument. Throws error if multiple indicies are found or none are found.

class wisps.data_mgmt.Time.PhenomenonTimePeriod(**kwargs)¶

Bases: wisps.data_mgmt.Time.Time

Class representing the Phenomenon Time Period Phenomenon time is colloquially, when the weather happens. It can be either an instant in time or A period of time.

get_dimensions()¶

Return a tuple of dimension names. Will account for data with different shapes.

get_duration()¶
get_index(num_seconds)¶

Returns index where the lead time data equals num_seconds. Only checks if the start bound is equal to the input argument. Throws error if multiple indicies are found or none are found.

get_name(nc_handle)¶

Looks for a match in Time variables. Returns a tuple containing the [0] - name of the variable and [1] - a boolean indicating if it already existed.

Writes beg_end_bounds variable to netcdf file.

class wisps.data_mgmt.Time.ResultTime(**kwargs)¶

Bases: wisps.data_mgmt.Time.Time

Class representing the Result time. The result time is when the result (analysis, forcast) became available to data consumers. Must be an instant in time.

append_result(result_time)¶

Adds the Result Time.

class wisps.data_mgmt.Time.Time(**kwargs)¶

Baseclass representing time.

given iterable list of dimensions, creates dimensions.

Provides a way for accessing the name of the start and end dimension.

Return a tuple of dimension names. Will account for data with different shapes.

get_end_time()¶
get_name(nc_handle)¶

Looks for a match in Time variables. Returns a tuple containing the [0] - name of the variable and [1] - a boolean indicating if it already existed.

get_start_time()¶
get_stride(as_timedelta=False)¶

Returns the number of seconds between two time steps. This function may provide misleading information if timesteps have an irregular step duration.

init_time_data(start_date, end_date, stride)¶

Fills the arrays with appropriate data. start and end dates can be of type datetime, str (YYYYMMDD), or int (epoch time in seconds). end_time is non-inclusive.

is_duration()¶

Returns if the current object is a type of duration

write_to_nc(nc_handle)¶

Adds the netCDF Variable representation of the Time. If Time variable already exists, it will return None. Additional Time variables of same type will have consecutive integers appended on the end of the variable name.

class wisps.data_mgmt.Time.ValidTime(**kwargs)¶

Bases: wisps.data_mgmt.Time.Time

Class representing the valid time. The valid time is the time of intended use. Must be a period of time.

add_offset(offset)¶

Offset can be: a function that is applied to the data array, a timedelta duration, a datetime fixed date, or a 0 representing an unlimited valid time

get_dimensions()¶

Return a tuple of dimension names. Will account for data with different shapes.

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.datetime_to_str(time)¶

Assumed that time is a datetime object. hours are represented YYYYMMDDHH

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.epoch_time(time)¶

Return hours array as seconds since the epoch, where time can be a datetime or str

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.epoch_to_datetime(seconds)¶

Converts epoch time to datetime

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.fast_arr_equal(arr1, arr2)¶

Determines if two arrays are equal. Confidence is low that they are indeed equal

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.get_lead_dim_name()¶

Provides a way for accessing the name of the time dimension.

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.get_time_dim_name()¶

Provides a way for accessing the name of the time dimension.

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.num_timesteps(start_time, end_time, stride=datetime.timedelta(0, 3600))¶

Calculates the number of timesteps between a start and end time with a certain duration. Assumes inclusive start and end times.

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.parse_ISO_standard_time(time)¶

Given a string that is the ISO standard representation of time, Return a the epoch time.

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.parse_development_sample(sample_str)¶

Given a string with an ISO interval representation, such as 2014-04-01/2014-09-30, returns tuple of 2 datetimes where index 0 = the start date, and index 1 = the end date

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.parse_forecast_reference_time(forecast_str)¶

Given a string of type YYYY-MM-DDTFF, returns the FF component, which represents the forcast reference time, as a tuple. Where index 0 = number of hours index 1 = number of seconds, and

wisps.data_mgmt.Time.str_to_datetime(time)¶

Assumed that time is in form YYYYMMDDHH

wisps.data_mgmt.Wisps_data module¶

class wisps.data_mgmt.Wisps_data.Wisps_data(name, autofill=True)¶

Bases: wisps.data_mgmt.nc_writable.nc_writable

WISPS data object for storing metadata and accompanied objects describing the variable.

This class will attempt to gather information from the metadata database on a given property, but any gaps will need to be provided by the user.

Attributes:

name (str): quick fill name that can be used to initialize variable from template. data (np.array): n-dimensional numpy array holding variable data. dimensions (list of str): The names of the dimensions–ordered by dimension. processes (list of Process): Process that modify this variable. metadata (dict): Metadata with key-value pairs. time (list of Time): Time objects describing this variable properties (dict): Metadata that will not be written to NetCDF file

that may be used internally.
Args:
name (str): quick-fill name that can be used to initialize variable from template. autofill (bool): If there should be an attempt to autofill metadata based on name.
Note:
Time objects must have a dimensionality that’s compatible with data.
add_bounds_process()¶

Adds a process representing the cell_method

add_data(data)¶

Given a numpy array with the correct dimensions, sets it to objects ‘data’ instance variable.

add_db_metadata()¶

Reads the metadata database and copies the metadata to this object.

add_elev_attributes(elev_var)¶

Adds Common elev attributes.

add_fcstTime(value)¶

Sets the LE_Source attribute to ‘value’.

add_leadTime(value)¶

Sets the LeadTime_hour attribute to ‘value’.

Given a key and value, adds it to the metadata

add_nc_data(nc_var)¶

Time intensive. See netCDF4.Variable.__setitem__

add_nc_metadata(nc_var)¶
add_plev_attributes(plev_var)¶

Adds Common Plev attributes.

add_process(process)¶

Adds a Process object to the Processes list or creates one if given a str.

add_source(value)¶

Sets the LE_Source attribute to ‘value’.

add_to_database(filename)¶

Add variable to the database for searching.

change_data_type(data_type=None)¶

Attempts to force the datatype to change for this data

check_correct_shape()¶
check_dimensions(nc_handle)¶

Check data dimension shape is equal to the nc handle dimension.

create_dimension(nc_handle, dimension_name)¶

Creates a netCDF dimension for each of the individual dimensions in the object.

create_dimensions(nc_handle)¶

Check if self.dimensions are defined in the netcdf file. If they are not create them.

get_cell_methods()¶

Return a dictionary representing cell methods, where the key is the coordinate that the cell method modifies, and the value is the method itself.

get_chunk_size()¶
get_coord_name(nc_handle, coord_name, is_bounds=False)¶

Given a ‘coord_name’ such as plev or elev, finds if a variable already fits the coordinate for this object. If one is not found, returns a new, unique name.

get_coordinate()¶

Returns the value of the coordinate data if it has one. If this variable is a bounds, return a tuple of the bounds. Otherwise return None

get_data_type()¶

Check if data_type is defined in the properties database for this variable name. Return value if available, otherwise throw ValueError.

get_dimensions()¶

Check if dimensions is defined in the properties database for this variable name. Return value if available, otherwise throw ValueError.

get_fill_value()¶

Return fill_value metadata attribute

get_lead_time()¶

Returns leadTime if it exists.

get_observedProperty()¶

Returns the parsed OM_observedProperty metadata element.

get_phenom_time()¶

Returns instant or period phenomenon time if it exists

get_process_str()¶

Returns a string representation of the process. i.e. A comma separated name of the process enclosed in parens.

get_result_time()¶

Returns resultTime if it exists.

get_source()¶

Return the source metadata attribute.

get_time(time_type)¶

Returns a time of type time_type or None if there’s no such instance

get_time_bounds()¶

Returns phenomenonTimePeriod if exists.

get_variable_name()¶

Returns a uniqueish vairable name such that it looks like, <dataSource>_<observedProperty>_<duration>_<verticalCoord>_<fcstReferenceTime>_<fcstLeadTime>_<########>

has_bounds()¶

Checks metadata to see if this variable has a bounds attribute.

has_elev()¶

Checks metadata to see if this has elev.

has_elev_bounds()¶

Returns True if metadata indicates variable has plev bounds.

has_plev()¶

Checks metadata to see if this has plev.

has_plev_bounds()¶

Returns True if metadata indicates variable has plev bounds.

has_time_bounds()¶

Checks metadata to see if this variable time bounds.

in_metadata(var)¶

Boolean weather var is in metadata dictionary

is_feature_of_interest()¶

Checks metadata to see if this variable is a feature of interest.

is_model()¶

Returns True if the Source is from a model. Currently, ‘GFS’ and ‘NAM’

reshape(nc_handle)¶

Reshapes the data when adding the a coordinate dimension.

set_dimensions(dimensions=None)¶

Given a tuple of String dimensions, sets object to the dimensions.

write_to_nc(nc_handle)¶

Adds a netCDF variable to the nc_handle. Includes the data and metadata associated with the object.

wisps.data_mgmt.fetch module¶

wisps.data_mgmt.fetch.fetch(time=None, lead_time=None, **metadata_dict)¶

Given a properly formated metadata dictionary, finds the variable amongst the files. If the Observed property is recognized as a variable that needs to be computed, then a routine will be started to compute variables.

Metadata Keys w/ type:
‘property’ : str ‘source’ : str ‘start’ : int ‘end’ : int ‘duration’ : int ‘duration_method’ : str ‘vert_coord1’ : int ‘vert_coord2’ : int ‘vert_method’ : str
wisps.data_mgmt.fetch.find_date()¶
wisps.data_mgmt.fetch.printdict(dict)¶

Function to read a netCDF file of given filename into a list of WISPS data objects.

wisps.data_mgmt.reader.read_var(filepath, name, lead_time=None, phenom_time=None)¶

Returns a Wisps_data object from netcdf file. Optionally returns Wisps_data object with only a slice of data.

Removes Time metadata from attrs dict.

wisps.data_mgmt.reader.separate_coordinate_and_data(variables_dict)¶

Separates the variables into coordinate and predictor variables. Returns the processes and normal variables as a tuple.

wisps.data_mgmt.reader.separate_procedure_and_data(variables_dict)¶

Separates the variables into Processes and data-holding variables. Returns the processes and normal variables as a tuple.

wisps.data_mgmt.reader.separate_time_and_data(variables_dict)¶

Separates the variables into Time and predictor variables. Returns the processes and normal variables as a tuple.

wisps.data_mgmt.reader.subset_time(w_obj, nc_var, lead_time, time)¶

Only pull a slice of data from the netcdf variable if only a portion of time. rework time objects to reflect the subset.

wisps.data_mgmt.writer module¶

wisps.data_mgmt.writer.get_dimensions(wisps_data)¶

Checks if each object’s dimensions have the same length. Confirms shape of data is same number of dimensions. returns a dictionary where the key is the dimension name and the value is the number of elements.

wisps.data_mgmt.writer.get_primary_variables(w_list)¶

Return space-separated primary variables.

wisps.data_mgmt.writer.update_variable_db(w_obj)¶

Adds a new entry to the variable database

wisps.data_mgmt.writer.write(wisps_data, filename, global_attrs={}, overwrite=True, write_to_db=True)¶

Writes a list of Wisps_data to NetCDF file. wisps_data is expected to be a list of Wisps_data objects. filename is the filename to write to. global_attrs are additional global attributes to add to the file. overwite specifies whether a file should new or appended to.

Args:
wisps_data (list of Wisps_data or Wisps_data):
Wisps_data or list of Wisps_data objects to be written to NetCDF file.

filename (str): NetCDF filename. global_attrs (dict): Dict of global attributes for NetCDF file. overwrite (bool): If true, write a new file regardless of whether a file

already exists, otherwise append to existing file if possible.

write_to_db (bool): write to database

Returns:
True if successful, False otherwise.
wisps.data_mgmt.writer.write_global_attributes(nc, extra_globals)¶

Writes the global attributes as defined in netcdf.yml. Also may add additional information.
